question.xref: DES s6, HC p114, KYTS p9, KYTS p67
question.text: At this junction there is a stop sign with a solid white line on the road surface. Why is there a stop sign here?

explanation.text: If your view is restricted at a road junction you must stop. There may also be a ‘stop’ sign. Don’t emerge until you’re sure there’s no traffic approaching. IF YOU DON’T KNOW, DON’T GO.

answer.text: Speed on the major road is de-restricted
Visibility along the major road is restricted
There are hazard warning lines in the centre of the road
